content: in the 3 double_crochet spacing whereas rounds 9-12 marked with a b will result in 2 double_crochet spacing please consistently follow either the a or b instructions yarn over hook yoh insert hook ih through stitch and draw yarn through dyt to make a third loop on hook yoh and dyt two loops on hook so that two loops remain note the slip_stitch that finishes each round does not count as a stitch for stitch count on hook yoh ih again through same stitch as previous and dyt to make another two purposes and as such this stitch should not be worked into in the subsequent round loops on hook four loops on hook in total yoh dyt two loops on hook so that three loops remain on hook yoh dyt all three loops on hook round 1 make a circle note beginning chain 2 does not count as a stitch 1 with first colour yarn make a closed circle using either magic_ring or 3-4 chain and 2dctog then slip_stitch into first chain yarn over hook yoh insert hook ih through stitch and draw yarn through dyt to 2 chain 2 then double_crochet 11 times into circle if using magic_ring now pull taut make a third loop on hook yoh and dyt two loops on hook so that two loops remain 3 slip_stitch into first double_crochet skip 2 chain to close circle on hook yoh ih through next stitch and dyt four loops on hook in total yoh dyt stitch count 11 double_crochet excluding beginning 2 chain two loops on hook so that three loops remain on hook yoh dyt all three loops on round 2 double the stitch count hook 1 to commence the round stndst3 in first double_crochet from previous round 2hdctog 2 double_crochet in the same stitch that the stndst was made yarn over hook yoh insert hook ih through stitch and draw yarn through dyt to 3 2 double_crochet in each of the remaining stitches around make a third loop on hook yoh ih through next stitch and dyt five loops on hook in 4 slip_stitch into the stndst from step 1 total yoh dyt all loops on hook stitch count 22 double_crochet 2 dcs made in each stitch from round 1 3dctog round 3 increase in every second stitch same principle as 2dctog except an additional stitch is worked over 1 to commence the round stndst in stndst from previous round 2 2 double_crochet in the next stitch 2hdctog 3 double_crochet in the next stitch same principle as 2hdctog except an additional stitch is worked over 4 2 double_crochet in the next stitch 5 repeat steps 3 and 4 nine times 6 slip_stitch into the stndst from step 1 stitch count 33 double_crochet round 4 increase in every third stitch 1 to commence the round stndst in stndst from previous round 2 double_crochet in the next stitch 3 or substitute with 3 chain for stndst and 2 chain for hdcstndst if you prefer then use
